column5:
Exposed a reference to the default scheduler.

Closes issues #204.

Ensure that fallbacks can change failures to successful results

Fixes Issue #206.
Add favicon patching to javadoc script

FailsafeFuture should be public

Fixes issue #203.
Updated contributing docs to include feature requests and doc fixes
Migrate from readme to proper project website

DelegatingScheduler improvements

- Use setRemoveOnCancelPolicy(true) for internal delayer
- Only synchronize if ForkJoinPool is being used
Minor doc fixes and code org

Do not wrap synchronous execution Errors

- Do not wrap synchronous execution Errors in FailsafeException
- Shrink the number of internal Functions
Removed unused CircuitBreakerInternals ref from CircuitBreaker

fix: FailurePolicy.handle is a SafeVargs method (#199)

This fixes the compilation warning when using the FailurePolicy#handle(java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Throwable>...) method:

```
[WARNING] unchecked generic array creation for varargs parameter of type java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Throwable>[]
```

- Handle Throwables when scheduling
- Use CompletableFuture.whenComplete instead of handle where possible
Guard against potential race between Timeout interrupt and execution completion
Should clear interrupt flag after non-interruptable synchronous execution
ExecutionResult should avoid unnecessary object allocations
Add test to assert that ForkJoinPool clears interrupt flags
Clear timeout delegates after cancellation and execution
Do not block when an error occurs in an event listener
Updated DelegatingScheduler to create an internal ForkJoinPool when the common pool's parallelism is insufficient

Misc improvements

- Fix fragile async timeout test
- Add more JDKs to travis build
- Workaround compilation problem on java 11 with Failsafe.with(Policy...)
Update readme on cancellation, changelog for release
Support external cancellation of a FailsafeFuture with ExecutionContext.isCancelled
Use TimeoutExceededException to fail on Timeout

Timeout and interruption improvements

- Move policy executors to top level package for easier access to package private AbstractExecutor and FailsafeFuture members
- Track and cancel multiple timeout delegates in FailsafeFuture when cancelling a delegate
- Only reset interrupt thread on synchronous executions when not explicitly interrupted by failsafe
- Record executions after an interruption
Only interrupt ForkJoinPool tasks that are successfully cancelled

Improve timeouts and deprecate CircuitBreaker.withTimeout

- Add Timeout support for async executions
- Deprecate CircuitBreaker.withTimeout
Improve FailsafeExecutor javadocs around sync execution failures due to checked exceptions

Add support for getElapsedAttemptTime

- Add support for getElapsedAttemptTime
- Change CircuitBreakerExecutor to use getElapsedAttemptTime for timeouts

Add Timeout policy implementation

- Added Timeout policy implementation
- Added ExecutionContext.isCancelled support
- Reset interrupt flag when a synchronous execution is interrupted
- Improved handling around externally completing a Failsafe CompletableFuture
Moved the calling of completion listener from AsyncExecutor to FailsafeFuture
Remove ExecutionResult refs from CircuitBreaker classes
Add note about FailurePolicy API to 2.0 changelog
Fix computed delay links in readme

Added support for CircuitBreaker DelayedFunctions

- Added CircuitBreaker.withDelay(DelayFunction)
- Moved some of the delay configuration to DelayablePolicy

Fixes #180

Add reference to CircuitBreaker inside CircuitBreakerOpenException

Fixes #188

Add getLastResult and getLastFailure to ExecutionContext

Fixes #163
Related to #105

Detect successAll for async executions

Fixes Issue #190.

PolicyListeners are not getting copied in the RetryPolicy copy constructor. (#191)

So when onFailed() or onSuccess() are defined, and RetryPolicy.copy() is called,
those handlers are not getting copied over.

Ensure that result handling is not performed more than once for async executions.

Fixes issue #192.

Minor concurrency improvements

- Removed some volatiles in favor of synchronized blocks
Added Javadoc to mention that exceptions thrown from within event listeners are ignored.

Allow null fallback values.

Partially addresses #177.

Fix doc comment (#187)

The value of `delay` is set 1 minute but the doc comment is `Duration.ZERO`

chore: fix Maven warning (#176)

Maven Jar plug-in needs a version

chore: cache mvn build directories (#175)

Faster builds in Travis
Interrupt ForkJoinPool threads when mayInterruptIfRunning is true
Switch to shields.io for javadoc badge
Add type param to Javadoc in Failsafe class

Make ForkJoinPool executions cancellable

- Makes ForkJoinPool executions properly cancellable
- Renames CommonPoolScheduler -> DelegatingScheduler
Add support for adapting an ExecutorService instance to a Scheduler
Assert that an execution is interrupted when cancelling and using a ScheduledExecutor
PolicyExecutor should accept AbstractExecutor as a constructor param
Update FailsafeExecutor javadoc to reference Failsafe class
Add circuit breaker metrics to readme

Simplify detached async execution

Simplifies detached async execution by pre-creating internal Suppliers and swapping async execution results into the inner supplier so that Suppliers don't need to be re-created.

Added support for async Fallback execution

- Added support for async Fallback execution
- Consolidated the Fallback APIs a bit to be based on ExecutionAttemptedEvents
Fixed up some test method names
Renamed future related tests to stage

Introduce max attempts, default max attempts to 3

- Introduces RetryPolicy.withMaxAttempts
- Defaults max attempts to 3
Remove Java 11 from travis builds for now since the JDK binaries are failing to install
Require multiple policies to be set at the same time

Add sync and async policy composition tests

- Test various combinations of policies
- Test nested retry policies
- Test retry policies where one policy is exceeded
Added success and failure stats to CircuitBreaker

Implemented separate event types

- Renamed FailsafeEvent to ExecutionEvent
- Implemented ExecutionAttempted and ExecutedCompleted events
Call Policy completion handlers once per Policy completion

Update travis and maven config

- remove oracle-java8 addon
- include openjdk11
- update jacoco dep
- update mockito dep

Added more listener tests

- Added more listener tests
- Adjusted AbstractPolicy.isFailure to require require a failureCondition, else not depend on the previous ExecutionResult

Move towards java.time APIs

- Replaced long + TimeUnit with Duration
- Replaced TimeUnit with ChronoUnit

Also

- Resolved race in ListenersTest
- Remove 1x readme for now

Publish Policy success/failure events

- Publish Policy success/failure events
- Update Listener tests for policy events
Allow CircuitBreaker to have a delay of 0
Set 1 minute default delay for CircuitBreaker.

Re-work async policy handling

- Replaced internal async policy pipeline with CompletableFuture based impl
- Renamed Callable references to Supplier
- Simplified FailsafeFuture
- Exposed CompletableFuture as result for async methods
- Renamed FailsafeExecutor.future methods to futureAsync
Collapse event listener overloads into a single method that takes a FailsafeEvent
Removed event listeners that receive ExecutorService
Rename Failsafe.futureAsync -> futureAsyncExecution (for now) for consistenty
Unify the Sync and Async Failsafe APIs.
Add a few more policy composition tests
Replace Failsafe's Predicate interface with java.util.function.Predicate
Move failure handling Predicates to AbstractPolicy

Add unified Policy condition API

- Add a unified Policy condition API
- Add separate onSuccess and onFailure handling for policy executors
- Move isFailure base logic to PolicyExecutor
- Updated sync and async FailsafeConfig tests to expect success when an unhandled exception type is thrown

Add a CommonPoolScheduler implementation

Adds a ForkJoinPool.commonPool backed Scheduler implementation that uses a separate scheduler for triggering delays and the common pool for actual execution.

Co-authored-by: Ben Manes <ben.manes@gmail.com>
Replace internal Duration impl with java.time.Duration
Move listener related config to Listeners class
Pin vertx example to a specific version

Misc refactorings

- Renamed PolicyResult to ExecutionResult
- Moved ExecutionResult to be a top level class
- Simplified internal event handlers
- Improved handling of no result executions
- Simplified fallback methods in FailsafeConfig
- Documented RejectedExecutionException on AsyncFailsafe
- Add explicit handling for scheduling errors
Move sync wait logic from RetryPolicyExecutor to PolicyExecutor
Remove FailsafeFuture from public API return type

Add support for composable policies

- Adds new FailsafePolicy and PolicyExecutor SPIs
- Adds separate FailsafePolicy and executor implemenations for RetryPolicy, CircuitBreaker, and Fallback

# Conflicts:
#	CHANGES.md
#	README.md
#	src/main/java/net/jodah/failsafe/AbstractExecution.java
#	src/main/java/net/jodah/failsafe/CircuitBreaker.java

CircuitBreaker + Predicate + Failure interaction. (#131)

* Failing test with CircuitBreaker + Predicate + Failure interaction.

* Tests are only run if they end in *Test.java!

http://maven.apache.org/surefire/maven-surefire-plugin/examples/inclusion-exclusion.html

* Went ahead and implemented fixes.

* Fill in test coverage for missing branches.

* Remove PR discussion comments. Ready to merge.

* Minor comment fix.

* Add RetryPolicy Predicate exception-handling.

Add issues tests to `mvn test`. (#132)

I was quite surprised to find that my failing test in https://github.com/jhalterman/failsafe/pull/131 passed `mvn test` during CI. Turns out that the tests in `src/test/java/**/issues/` aren't run because their names don't end with `*Test.java`.

Per http://maven.apache.org/surefire/maven-surefire-plugin/examples/inclusion-exclusion.html:

> By default, the Surefire Plugin will automatically include all test classes with the following wildcard patterns:
>
> * `"**/Test*.java"` - includes all of its subdirectories and all Java filenames that start with "Test".
> * `"**/*Test.java"` - includes all of its subdirectories and all Java filenames that end with "Test".
> * `"**/*Tests.java"` - includes all of its subdirectories and all Java filenames that end with "Tests".
> * `"**/*TestCase.java"` - includes all of its subdirectories and all Java filenames that end with "TestCase".

We could configure them to be run with regex, but it seems easier to just rename them to fit the convention. Convention over configuration, right?
Updated readme with additional delay features

- Added random delays
- Simplified dynamic delay fallback tests
Added dynamic delay fallback to static/backoff delay tests

Restrict jitter relative to delay.

Fixes #115 and fixes #116.
A bit of RetryPolicy method renaming

- Added RetryPolicy .withDelayOn and .withDelayWhen
- Updated dynamic delay to fallback to static (fixed / backoff) delay when a negative return value is supplied
- Async execution scheduling should include jitter

Dynamic delay (#111)

* Dynamic delay computation

* Move dynamic delay test to own package.
Wrap checked exceptions as unchecked in applying
delay function.

* More test coverage

* Use functional interface DelayFunction instead of CheckedBiFunction.
Removed test of throwing checked exception from delay function, since
delay functions no longer throw checked exceptions.

* PR #111: remove unused import

* PR #111: type-specific delay functions

* PR #111: rename withDelayFunction to withDelay,
add overload with delay function and failure type.

* PR #111: no two-arg variants of withDelay(DelayFunction...)
Update README to avoid withFallback ambiguity.

Support CompletionStage instead of CompletableFuture in AsyncFailsafe… (#118)

* Support CompletionStage instead of CompletableFuture in AsyncFailsafe.future(...) and AsyncFailsafe.futureAsync(...)

* Remove unrelated changes to .gitignore

Merge pull request #123 from Fokko/fd-reset-jitterfactor

Ability to reset the jitterFactor

Update withJitter assert error

Accept 0.0 as withJitter

If we don't want to set the jitter factor after all, we can reset it
by setting it back to 0.0.

Update the assert error

The `withJitter(long)` does not exists, this should be `withJitter(double)`.

Ensure that `onRetriesExceeded` is not called if last retry is successful.

Update AbstractExecution.java

If the last retry is successful, the handleRetriesExceeded gets called because the number of executions is greater than the max number of retries (i.e. it includes the first execution). I wonder if we need to check whether the result was successful or not?

Async result futures should always be completed exceptionally (less any fallback handling) when CircuitBreakerOpenException occurs immediately upon invocation.
